{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3503332,"name":"Sean","username":"Skimonster110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skimonster110/{size}/261842_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T20:29:32.205Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm a part of a rookie team and we need a rug or carpet for testing swerve. The one first uses/recommends is sold out. Dose anyone have a good alternative they use.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-05T20:29:32.205Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":78.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":485337,"topic_slug":"carpet-or-rug-advice","display_username":"Sean","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69545,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Electrical "},"post_url":"/t/carpet-or-rug-advice/485337/1","custom_user_title":"Electrical ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3503336,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-05T20:36:12.575Z","cooked":"

From 5.1 in the game manual

The surface of the FIELD is low pile carpet, Shaw Floors, Philadelphia Commercial, Neyland II 20, ‚Äú66561 Medallion.‚Äù
Neyland II carpet is not available for purchase, and the closest equivalent is Shaw, Philadelphia Brand, Profusion 20, Style 54933; see results from FIRST‚Äôs evaluation in this blog post.

Reach out to some local teams about practicing on their field, or possibly even seeing if they have any excess carpet you could take.

Don‚Äôt know what it‚Äôs like in NE, but in FiM, sometimes event setup teams get to keep event carpet (bc it‚Äôs such a pain to move around), and those teams may have extra they‚Äôd just rather get rid of.

banjogates:

Reach out to some local teams about practicing on their field

I won‚Äôt go far into it, but we can‚Äôt transport ourselves to another space due to limitations with student‚Äôs abilities to, safety protocols, and the fact busing is $500 a day. We would need to buy/borrow carpet.

We‚Äôll reach out to some local teams though! Thanks

I‚Äôd refer to this thread, where many teams went to find substitutes for the carpet listed in the manual.

FRC Carpet Field Info General Forum
We are looking to purchase new carpet for our practice field. Upon looking at past threads and trying to recall what I read about a year ago, I cant find any info on the type (model) used currently at FRC competitions. Please share if you have more info/insight. We havent paid attention much since we had carpets from previous Hawaii regionals, but havent replaced our current practice field in years. Our current one is trashed after this past season. Mahalo
